metadata.title: CVE-2021-20225 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. The option parserallows an attacker to write past the end of a heap-allocated buffer bycalling certain commands with a large number of specific short forms ofoptions. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.167.2+2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.167.2+2.04-1ubuntu44.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2-unsigned package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu44.2').
grub2-signed package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.167.2').
